questionContent.questionText:
1. -cele [hernia]

2. -emia [blood condition]

3. -coccus [berry-shaped bacterium]

4. -gram [record]

5. -cyte [cell]

6. -algia [pain]

7. -ectomy [removal/excision/resection]

8. -centesis [puncture to remove fluid]

9. -genesis [process of producing/forming/process of forming]

10. -graph [instrument to record]

11. -itis [inflammation]

12. -graphy [process of recording]

instructions.instructions: Give the meanings for the following sufﬁxes.

readingPart.reading:
amni/ocyst/o myel/o 
angi/o isch/o rhin/o 
arthr/olaryng/o staphyl/o 
bronch/o mast/o  strept/o  
carcin/o my/o  thorac/o

questionContent.questionText:
1. hernia of the urinary bladder [cystocele]

2. pain of muscle [myalgia]

3. process of producing cancer [carcinogenesis ]

4. inﬂammation of the spinal cord [myelitis]

5. berry-shaped bacteria in twisted chains [streptococci]

6. surgical puncture to remove ﬂuid from the chest [thoracentesis or thoracocentesis]

7. removal of the breast [mastectomy]

8. inﬂammation of the tubes leading from the windpipe to the lungs [bronchitis]

9. to hold back blood from cells [ischemia]

10. process of recording (x-ray) blood vessels [angiography]

11. visual examination of joints [arthroscopy]

12. berry-shaped bacteria in clusters [staphylococci]

13. resection of the voice box [laryngectomy]

14. surgical procedure to remove ﬂuid from the sac around a fetus [amniocentesis] 

15. discharge from the nose [rhinorrhea ]

instructions.instructions: Using the listed combining forms and your knowledge of sufﬁxes, build medical terms for the deﬁnitions that follow.

readingPart.reading:
basophillymphocyteneutrophil
eosinophilmonocytethrombocyte
erythrocyte

questionContent.questionText:
1. granulocytic white blood cell (granules stain purple) that destroys foreign cells by engulﬁng and digesting them; also called a polymorphonuclear leukocyte [neutrophil]

2. mononuclear white blood cell that destroys foreign cells by making antibodies [lymphocyte]

3. clotting cell; also called a platelet [thrombocyte]

4. leukocyte with reddish-staining granules and numbers elevated in allergic reactions [eosinophil]

5. red blood cell [erythrocyte]

6. mononuclear white blood cell that engulfs and digests cellular debris; contains one large nucleus [monocyte]

7. granulocytic white blood cell that increases during the healing phase of inﬂammation [basophil]

instructions.instructions: Match the listed terms, which describe blood cells, with the meanings that follow.

questionContent.questionText:
1. -logy [process of study]

2. -lysis [breakdown/separation/destruction]

3. -pathy [process of disease/disease]

4. -penia [deficiency/less than normal]

5. -malacia [softening]

6. -osis [condition/abnormal condition]

7. -phobia [fear of/fear]

8. -megaly [enlargement]

9. -oma [tumor/mass]

10. -opsy [process of viewing/view of]

11. -plasia [condition of formation/growth/formation/condition of growth]

12. -plasty [surgical repair]

13. -sclerosis [hardening/to harden]

14. -stasis [to stop/control/to control]

instructions.instructions: Give the meanings of the following sufﬁxes

readingPart.reading:
acr/o chondr/omyel/o
arteri/o hem/o phleb/o
bi/o hydr/orhin/o
blephar/o morph/osarc/o
cardi/o my/osplen/o

questionContent.questionText:
1. enlargement of the spleen [splenomegaly]

2. study of the shape (of cells) [morphology]

3. softening of cartilage [chondromalacia]

4. abnormal condition of water (ﬂuid) in the kidney [hydronephrosis]

5. disease condition of heart muscle [cardiomyopathy]

6. hardening of arteries [arteriosclerosis]

7. tumor (benign) of muscle [myoma]

8. ﬂesh tumor (malignant) of muscle [myosarcoma]

9. surgical repair of the nose [rhinoplasty]

10. tumor of bone marrow [myeloma (called multiple myeloma)]

11. fear of heights [acrophobia]

12. view of living tissue under a microscope [biopsy]

13. stoppage of the ﬂow of blood (by mechanical or natural means) [hemostasis]

14. inﬂammation of the eyelid [blepharitis]

15. incision of a vein [phlebotomy ]

instructions.instructions: Using the combining forms below and your knowledge of sufﬁxes, build medical terms for the following deﬁnitions.

questionContent.questionText:
1. bacterium [bacteria]

2. metastasis [metastases]

3. vertebra [vertebrae]

4. streptococcus [streptococci]

5. nucleus [nuclei]

6. prognosis [prognoses]

instructions.instructions: Give the plural formations of the following terms:

readingPart.reading:
achondroplasiacolostomylaparoscopy
acromegalyhydrotherapymetastasis
atrophyhypertrophynecrosis
chemotherapylaparoscopeosteomalacia

questionContent.questionText:
1. treatment using drugs [chemotherapy]

2. condition of death (of cells) [necrosis]

3. softening of bone [osteomalacia]

4. opening of the large intestine to the outside of the body [colostomy]

5. no development; shrinkage of cells [atrophy]

6. beyond control; spread of a cancerous tumor to another organ [metastasis]

7. instrument to visually examine the abdomen [laparoscope]

8. enlargement of extremities; an endocrine disorder that causes excess growth hormone to be produced by the pituitary gland after puberty [acromegaly]

9. condition of improper formation of cartilage in the embryo that leads to short bones and dwarﬁsm [achondroplasia]

10. process of viewing the peritoneal (abdominal) cavity [laparoscopy]

11. treatment using water [hydrotherapy]

12. excessive development of cells (increase in size of individual cells) [hypertrophy]

instructions.instructions: Match the following terms with their meanings.

questionContent.questionText:
1. -ia [condition]

2. -trophy [development/nourishment]

3. -stasis [to stop/control/to control/controlling/stopping]

4. -stomy [new opening]

5. -tomy [incision/cut into]

6. -ole [small/little]

7. -um [structure]

8. -ule [small/little]

9. -y [condition/process]

10. -oid [resembling]

11. -genic [pertaining to producing/produced by or in]

12. -ptosis [falling/drooping/prolapse]

questionContent.questionText:
1. incision of the abdomen [laparotomy]

2. process of visual examination of the abdomen [laparoscopy]

3. a small artery [arteriole]

4. condition of the lungs [pneumonia]

5. treatment using x-rays [radiotherapy]

6. record (x-ray ﬁlm) of the breast [mammogram]

7. pain of the chest wall and the membranes surrounding the lungs [pleurodynia]

8. a small vein [venule]

9. disease condition of the kidney [nephropathy]

10. surgical repair of the breast [mammoplasty]

instructions.instructions: Using the lists of combining forms and sufﬁxes below, build medical terms for the following deﬁnitions.

questionContent.questionText:
1. pertaining to the voice box: laryng[eal/al/ic/ary/tic]
2. pertaining to the groin: inguin[al/eal/ic/ary/tic]
3. pertaining to time (over a long period of time): chron[ic/al/eal/ary/tic]
4. pertaining to the lung: pulmon[ary/ic/al/eal/tic]
5. pertaining to (or full of) fat: adip[ose/us/oid/ous]
6. pertaining to the peritoneum (membrane around the abdominal organs): periton[eal/al/ic/ary/tic]
7. pertaining to the armpit, under arm: axill[ary/ic/al/eal/tic]
8. pertaining to death: necro[tic/al/eal/ary/ic]
9. substance derived from opium: opi[oid/ose/us/ous]
10. pertaining to mucus: muc[ous/ose/us/oid]
11. fear of open spaces and being away from home alone: agora[phobia/ary/tic/oid]
12. tube leading from the throat to the stomach: esophag[us/ose/oid/ous]

instructions.instructions: From the dropdown, select the suffix that best completes the described term.

readingPart.reading:
anemiahemostasismyocardial
angioplastyischemianeutropenia
arteriolesleukemiathrombocytopenia
hematomaleukocytosisvenules
hemolysismultiple myeloma

questionContent.questionText:
1. Billy was diagnosed with excessively high numbers of cancerous white blood cells, or [leukemia]. His doctor prescribed chemotherapy and expected an excellent prognosis.

2. Mr. Clark’s angiogram showed that he had serious atherosclerosis of one of the arteries supplying blood to his heart. His doctor recommended that [angioplasty] would be helpful to open up his clogged artery by threading a catheter (tube) through his artery and opening a balloon at the end of the catheter to widen the artery.

3. Due to the shock of multiple foot strikes, long-distance runners can develop breakdown of red blood cells called [hemolysis]. This condition, which leads to excessive loss of blood cells is known as runner’s [anemia].

4. Doctors refused to operate on Joe because of his low platelet count, a condition called [thrombocytopenia].

5. Blockage of an artery leading to Mr. Stein’s brain led to the holding back of blood ﬂow to nerve tissue in his brain. This condition, called [ischemia], could lead to necrosis of tissue and a cerebrovascular accident.

6. Small arteries, or [arterioles], were broken under Ms. Bein’s scalp when she was struck on the head with a rock. She soon developed a mass of blood, a/an [hematoma], under the skin in that region of her head.

7. Sarah Jones had a staphylococcal infection, causing elevation of her white blood cell count, known as [leukocytosis]. She was treated with antibiotics, and her blood count returned to normal.

8. Within the body, the bone marrow (soft tissue within bones) is the “factory” for making blood cells. Mr. Scott developed [multiple myeloma], a malignant condition of the bone marrow cells in his hip, upper arm, and thigh bones.

9. During operations, surgeons use clamps to close off blood vessels and prevent blood loss. In this way, they maintain [hemostasis] and avoid blood transfusions.

10. Small vessels that carry blood toward the heart from capillaries and tissues are [venules].

11. Chemotherapy causes destruction of rapidly dividing cancer cells as well as rapidly dividing normal white blood cells. This deﬁciency of white blood cells is a side effect of chemotherapy called [neutropenia].

12. An acute [myocardial] infarction is the medical term for a heart attack.

instructions.instructions: Select from the listed terms relating to blood and blood vessels to complete the sentences that follow.

questionContent.questionText:
1. membrane surrounding the heart: peri[cardium]

2. hardening of arteries: arterio[sclerosis]

3. enlargement of the liver: hepato[megaly]

4. new opening of the windpipe to the outside of the body: [tracheo]stomy

5. inﬂammation of the tonsils: [tonsill]itis

6. surgical puncture to remove ﬂuid from the abdomen: [abdomino]centesis

7. muscle pain: my[algia]

8. pertaining to the membranes surrounding the lungs: [pleur]al

9. study of the eye: ophthalmo[logy]

10. berry-shaped (spheroidal) bacteria in clusters: [staphylo]cocci

11. beyond control (spread of a cancerous tumor): meta[stasis]

12. pertaining to the voice box: [laryng]eal

instructions.instructions: Complete the medical term for the following deﬁnitions.

questionContent.questionText:
Sufﬁxes: Conditions

1. -algia or -dynia [pain]

2. -cele [hernia]

3. -megaly [enlargement]

4. -oma [tumor; mass]

5. -penia [deﬁciency]

6. -phobia [fear]

7. -plasia [formation]

8. -emia [blood condition]

9. -itis [inﬂammation]

10. -trophy [development; nourishment]

11. -stasis [controlling; stopping]

12. -sclerosis [hardening]

13. -lysis [destruction; breakdown]

14. -ptosis [falling; drooping; prolapse]

15. -malacia [softening ]

instructions.instructions: Select from the meanings from the dropdown to match the sufﬁxes.

questionContent.questionText:
Sufﬁxes: Procedures

1. -centesis [puncture to remove ﬂuid]

2. -opsy [to view]

3. -ectomy [excision]

4. -tomy [incision]

5. -stomy [new opening]

6. -therapy [treatment]

7. -plasty [surgical repair]

8. -scopy [process of visual examination]

9. -scope [instrument to visually examine]

10. -graphy [process of recording]

11. -gram [record]

12. -graph [instrument to record]

instructions.instructions: Select from the meanings from the dropdown to match the sufﬁxes.

questionContent.questionText:
1.   Ms. Daley, who has nine children, visited her general practitioner because she was experiencing problems with urination. After examining her, the doctor found that her bladder was protruding into her vagina and told her she had a  [cystocele/rectocele/hiatal hernia].

2. Susan coughed constantly for a week. Her physician told her that her chest x-ray examination showed evidence of pneumonia. Her sputum (material coughed up from the bronchial tubes) was found to contain [pneumococcal/ischemic/pleuritic] bacteria.

3. Mr. Manion went to see his family doctor because he couldn’t keep his left upper eyelid from sagging. His doctor told him that he had a neurologic problem called Horner syndrome, characterized by [ptosis/necrosis/hydronephrosis] of his eyelid.

4. Jill broke her left arm in a fall while mountain biking. After 6 weeks in a cast to treat the fracture, her left arm was noticeably smaller and weaker than her right arm—the muscles had [atrophied/hypertrophied/metastasized] . Her physician recommended physical therapy to strengthen the affected arm.

5. Ms. Brody was diagnosed with breast cancer. The ﬁrst phase of her treatment included a [mastectomy/nephrectomy/pulmonary resection] to remove her breast and the tumor. After the surgery, her doctors recommended [chemotherapy/radiotherapy/hydrotherapy] using drugs such as doxorubicin (Adriamycin) and paclitaxel (Taxol).

6. At age 29, Kevin's facial features became coarser and his hands and tongue enlarged. After a head CT (computed tomography) scan, doctors diagnosed the cause of these changes as [acromegaly/hyperglycemia/hyperthyroidism] a slowly progressive endocrine condition involving the pituitary gland.

7. Each winter during “cold and ﬂu season,” Daisy developed [bronchitis/chondromalacia/cardiomyopathy]. Her doctor prescribed antibiotics and respiratory therapy to help her recover.

 8. After undergoing [arthroscopy/laparotomy/radiotherapy] on his knee, Alan noticed swelling and inﬂammation near the small incisions. Dr. Nicholas assured him that this was a common side effect of the procedure that would resolve spontaneously.

9. Under the microscope, Dr. Vance could see grape-like clusters of bacteria called [staphylococci/streptococci/eosinophils] . She made the diagnosis of [staphylococcemia/eosinophilia/streptococcemia], and the patient was started on antibiotic therapy.

10. David enjoyed weight lifting, but he recently noticed a bulge in his right groin region. He visited his doctor, who made the diagnosis of [inguinal hernia/hiatal hernia/rectocele] and recommended surgical repair.

instructions.instructions: Select the correct term to complete the following sentences.
